page.title: 01THE MID-TARRANT VALLEY
page.content: THE AREA IS MOSTLY AGRICULTURAL IN CHARACTER,THE MAIN FEATURE BEING THE VALLEY OF THE RIVER TARRANT WHICH RUNS FROM THE N.E. TO THE SOUTHERN BORDER. IN THE N.W. IS THE SOUTHERN LIMIT OF BLANDFORD ARMY CAMP & ASHLEY WOOD GOLF COURSE IS IN THE EXTREME WEST. THERE ARE TWO VILLAGES-RAWSTON(THE SMALLER)AND RUSHTON ON THE TARRANT. { HOUSING}APPROX.70 DWELLINGS RANGING FROM LARGE COUNTRY HOUSES TO OLD PEOPLES COUNCIL FLATLETS. {FARMS}DOWNBARN(MIXED),RAWSTON(DAIRY) LUTON(MIXED),HOGSTOCK(MAINLY ARABLE). {AMENITIES}GENERAL STORE(1),PHONEBOX(1) VILLAGE HALL (1),PARISH NOTICEBOARD(1) POST BOX(2),CHURCHES(2-ONE PRIVATE), BUSES(1/DAY,THURS & SAT.) {DELIVERIES}MILK(ALT.DAY),BAKER(3/WEEK) ICE-CREAM(2/WEEK),LIBRARY(FORTNIGHTLY)
